intro: Oxossia albicans, commonly known as the white oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces tiny, edible fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Oxossia albicans thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and indoor plant collections.
